hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Shaqiq: I was with Masruq at al-Silsilah for two years, and he would pray two rak'ahs, intending that to be the Sunnah. I heard him say: "I have never done a deed that I fear more will enter me into the Fire than this deed of mine. I did not take a single gold dinar or silver dirham, nor did I wrong any Muslim or a person under covenant, but I do not know what this rope (innovation) is which the Prophet ﷺ did not establish, nor did Abu Bakr nor 'Umar establish." He (Shaqiq) said: I said to him: "What made you return to it when you had abandoned it?" He said: "Ziyad and Surayh and the Devil encompassed me, and they kept beautifying it for me until they caused me to fall into it."

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ahmad ibn Abdullah ibn Yunus: I heard Abu Shahab mention, saying: "A female salt-seller of mine told me - Ahmad (the narrator) said: She was a Nabataean unbeliever who carried salt for him - She said: Whenever the rain ceased and drought affected us, we would go to Masruq's grave - and her house was at al-Silsilah - so we would ask for rain, and we would be given rain. She said: Then we would sprinkle his grave with wine (alcohol). Then he came to us in a dream and said: If you must do something, do it with sprinkling (water), and he died at al-Silsilah at Wasit. He (Ahmad) said: I was informed by Sufyan ibn 'Uyaynah, saying: Masruq remained after 'Alqamah, none would be preferred over him. It is also said by someone other than Sufyan ibn 'Uyaynah: Masruq died in the year 63 (AH), and he was trustworthy, and he has good hadiths."
